definition: to gather happily under one roof
to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

(main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: Families and communities share the happiness of gathering together for iftar and prayers.
sentences.chinese: 親朋好友歡聚一堂，共享齋月晚餐並共同祈禱。

sentences.english: All teachers and students gathered together and enjoyed this exquisite music.
sentences.chinese: 全體師生歡聚一堂，共同欣賞這別緻的樂章。

sentences.english: We are once again gathered here on this joyful occasion to celebrate the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我們再次在這裏歡聚一堂，共迎新年。

sentences.english: It is a true pleasure to be here with all of you.
sentences.chinese: 我非常榮幸地來到這裏，與大家歡聚一堂。

sentences.english: Families get together to eat mooncakes and celebrate the end of the harvest season on this day.
sentences.chinese: 每到這一天，親人都會歡聚一堂喫月餅並慶祝豐收。

sentences.english: Today, we are delighted to gather for the grand opening of the World Media Summit (WMS).
sentences.chinese: 今天，我們歡聚一堂，隆重召開世界媒體峯會。

sentences.english: Today we get together joyously, give our wonderful performance to welcome the new year.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我們歡聚一堂，拉開彙報演出的華麗序幕。

sentences.english: It gives me great pleasure to attend this luncheon, meeting all the friends, old and new.
sentences.chinese: 很高興出席今天的午餐會，與新老朋友歡聚一堂。

sentences.english: Members of the forum's organizing committee cheers with speakers.
sentences.chinese: 金融論壇組委會成員與嘉賓歡聚一堂，舉杯共慶。

definition: to get together all at once
to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
member of a board of directors
